May 229 1961
Harold E. Hill
Administrative Vice President
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
DuPont Circle Office Building
1346 Connecticut Avenue, N. W
Washington 69 D. C.
Dear Harold:
I have discussed the problems of being away from campus for three or
four contiguous days during the summer session with my boss here and
am afraid that Z will not be able to make it. I am scheduled to teach
classes five days a week and have already accepted commitments to
lecture on other campuses twice during the eight-week summer session.
The feeling here is that this would simply be too much, coming on top
of theee other absences. X feel badly about this because it sounds
as though it will be an excellent meeting. Though X was not present
at it, the Allerton House seminar report still seems to be one of the
outstanding documents ever drafted by an educational broadcasting group.
Xf you want a representative of the research committee present, and
X believe that one should be there, X would suggest Bruce Westley, who
will be on the campus presumably since he is teaching at Wisconsin.
X appreciate the invitation. X look forward to hearing the results of
the seminar.
Sincerely,
SLB;ks
Samuel L. Becker
Director, Division of
Television-Radio-Film
